DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Mammary Gland Tissue Anatomic Subsite Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The location of the mammary tissue from which the specimen was collected.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Mammary Gland Tissue Anatomic Subsite
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The glandular tissue of the breast.  In females, it is composed of numerous lobules with alveolar ducts and alveoli.  In males, it is composed of rudimentary glands._Relating to anatomy._A position within another named site.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Right Deep Surface Mammary Gland Tissue
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: Extending relatively far inward.: The extended two-dimensional outer boundary of a three-dimensional object.: The glandular tissue of the breast.  In females, it is composed of numerous lobules with alveolar ducts and alveoli.  In males, it is composed of rudimentary glands.
